result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:08 PM (64-06) Defendant Myriet Islami in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Myriet Islami.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Lettenberger is requesting an Arraignment date.

Adj. 3:12PM
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Myriet Islami in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Myriet Islami. Called @ 3:31 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance on 22CF317, 11th status on 20CF633, and 6th status on 21CF514. Record by Atty. Lettenberger who has gone over the charges/penalties and waives further reading of complaint. Requests preliminary hearing be set outside time limits with other files to track. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Myriet Islami in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DA Wiedenfeld.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Myriet Islami. Called @ 2:02 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 10th status on 20CF633 and 5th status on 21CF514, and return on warrant initial appearance on 22CF317. Record by Atty. Lettenberger as to outstanding warrants and asks that they be quashed and bond reinstated. State has no objection. Court quashes warrants and reinstates bond.  Atty. requests additional status about 30 days out. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:40 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Myriet Islami not in court. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Bond has today's date. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture hearing. Bond set 6-3-2022.
Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions.

1:26 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Myriet Islami appeared by video. Attorney Jason Daane in court for deft. 
Atty Daane has reviewed the notice of arrest. 
State asks for previous bond forfeited, state asks for $10,000 signature with $1,500 cash, same conditions as previous bond. 
Atty Daane asks that previous bond not be forfeited and would like a signature bond. 
Court grants State's request. 
Bond forfeited, $10,000 signature, $1500 cash, same prior conditions with pretrial services added.
Status set for June 14, 2022 @ 1:15pm, 3036

BOND TO COVER 20CF633, 21CF514, & 22GF556

DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES

Not to operate without insurance.
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
